content: Singapore Saving Bonds (SSB) Savings Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 19 Mar 2019I don't have much savings, where should I start investing?1 answerAnswerBump2
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardUpdated on 20 Mar 2019With $0: Start investing in your own financial knowledge:Read forums for financial knowledge. SeekingAlpha, MotleyFool, Seedly etc.Read quality news: Financial Times etc (subject to paywall)Read books on both Value Investing and investments in general. Assuming you are based in Singapore, our National Library is a good place to start.With $100: You can start investing with as little as $100 with Monthly Investment Plans for a start. Some to look at are:POSB Invest SaverOCBC Blue Chip Investment Plan (BCIP)Maybank Kim Eng Monthly Investment PlanPhillip Share Builder Plan0 comments2
